docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4.--News of the election of Agustin Edwards, Chilean Minister in England, as President of the Assembly of the League of Nations, was received with great interest in Latin American diplomatic circles here, satiafaction being...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4.--News of the election of Agustin Edwards, Chilean Minister in England, as President of the Assembly of the League of Nations, was received with great interest in Latin American diplomatic circles here, satiafaction being generally expressed.

headline.main: EDWARDS'S ELECTION PLEASES WASHINGTON; May, It Is Thought, Sway Argentina and Boliviato the League.

headline.main: Hughes to Reach Rio Janeiro Today; Secretary Exchanges Wireless Greetings

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Sept. 4.--The Third Assembly of the League of Nations began its sessions here today by electing Augustin Edwards, a Chilean delegate, President, and naming various committees to consider the subjects down for discussion on the agenda.
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Sept. 4.--The Third Assembly of the League of Nations began its sessions here today by electing Augustin Edwards, a Chilean delegate, President, and naming various committees to consider the subjects down for discussion on the agenda.

headline.main: LEAGUE ASKS ABOUT BRITISH MONOPOLY OF PHOSPHATE BEDS; Council Seeks to Discover Whether Powers Are Violating Spirit of Mandates. CHILEAN HEADS ASSEMBLY Augustin Edwards Receives 42 Votes Out of the 44 States Represented. DA GAMA OPENS SESSION Replies to Critics Who Assert That League is Dead and Scouts Idea of Super-State.

byline.original: By EDWUB K. JAMES. Copyright, 1922, by The New York Times Company. Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: RIO JANEIRO, Sept. 6 (Associated Press).--Guns boomed from the warShips of eight nations when the U.S.S. Maryland entered the harbor of Rio Janeiro yesterday afternoon carrying the American mission to the Brazilian Centennial, headed by Secretary of...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO JANEIRO, Sept. 6 (Associated Press).--Guns boomed from the warShips of eight nations when the U.S.S. Maryland entered the harbor of Rio Janeiro yesterday afternoon carrying the American mission to the Brazilian Centennial, headed by Secretary of State Hughes.

headline.main: HUGHES WELCOMED BY WARSHIPS' GUNS; American Secretary at Rio and Pays Visit to the President of Brazil and Foreign Minister., LODGED IN IMPERIAL PALACE Exposition Formally Opened Today, Though Not Complete--City Full of Foreign Visitors.
